required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Identifying Ultrasonic Diagnostic Characteristics of Cervical Lymphadenopathy: A Retrospective, Multicenter Study
clinical_study.official_title: Identifying Ultrasonic Diagnostic Characteristics of Cervical Lymphadenopathy: A Retrospective, Multicenter Study

lead_sponsor.agency: Second Affiliated Hospital, School of Medicine, Zhejiang University

clinical_study.source: Second Affiliated Hospital, School of Medicine, Zhejiang University

brief_summary.textblock: The observed indexes of the four cervical lymph node diseases were identified by informatics methods, and the differences in the diagnosis of the four diseases were evaluated, so as to improve the clinical diagnosis rate and provide a research basis for the ultrasonic evaluation of the surgical indications of cervical lymph node diseases in the future.

primary_outcome.time_frame: through study completion, an average of 1 year
primary_outcome.description: It was identified as cervical lymph node tuberculosis by imaging observation

primary_outcome.time_frame: through study completion, an average of 1 year
primary_outcome.description: It was identified as cervical lymphoma by imaging observation

primary_outcome.time_frame: through study completion, an average of 1 year
primary_outcome.description: It was identified as Cervical lymph node metastasis by imaging observation

primary_outcome.time_frame: through study completion, an average of 1 year
primary_outcome.description: It was identified as Cervical Reactive hyperplasia by imaging observation

arm_group.description: The patients with Cervical lymph nodes tuberculosis

intervention.description: Ultrasonic image collection,consist of three static images and one dynamic image

study_pop.textblock: Patients with one of these four diseases

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Patients with one of these four diseases
Exclusion Criteria:
- 1. Patients with severe heart and brain diseases and poor coagulation function. 2. Undiagnosed patients are not included in the statistical analysis. 3. Image distortion of CEUS acquisition cannot be analyzed.

facility.name: Department of Ultrasound, Second Affiliated Hospital, School of Medicine, Zhejiang University

patient_data.ipd_description: individual participant data(IPD) can be shared after the main unit publish articles
